title: Open Markets and Hybrid Jacobi Processes
abstract: arXiv:2110.14046v2 Announce Type: replace  Abstract: We propose a unified approach to several problems in Stochastic Portfolio Theory (SPT), which is a framework for equity markets with a large number $d$ of stocks. Our approach combines open markets, where trading is confined to the top $N$ capitalized stocks as well as the market portfolio consisting of all $d$ assets, with a parametric family of models which we call hybrid Jacobi processes. We provide a detailed analysis of ergodicity, particle collisions, and boundary attainment, and use these results to study the associated financial markets. Their properties include (1) stability of the capital distribution curve and (2) unleveraged and explicit growth optimal strategies. The sub-class of rank Jacobi models are additionally shown to (3) serve as the worst-case model for a robust asymptotic growth problem under model ambiguity and (4) exhibit stability in the large-$d$ limit. translated_title: 开放市场与混合雅各比过程
translated_abstract: 我们提出了一个统一的方法来解决随机投资组合理论（SPT）中的几个问题，这是一个涉及大量股票$d$的权益市场框架。我们的方法将开放市场（交易仅限于前$N$个市值最高的股票以及由所有$d$个资产组成的市场组合）与一个我们称为混合雅各比过程的参数化模型族相结合。我们对遗传性、粒子碰撞和边界达成进行了详细分析，并利用这些结果来研究相关金融市场。它们的特性包括(1) 资本分配曲线的稳定性和(2) 无杠杆和显式增长最优策略。雅各比排名模型子类还被额外证明(3) 在模型模糊性下作为一个强鲁棒性渐近增长问题的最坏情形模型，以及(4) 在大$d$极限下表现出稳定性。我们对开放市场的定义是对现有市场的放宽。
tldr: 该论文提出了一个统一方法来解决随机投资组合理论中的问题，结合开放市场和混合雅各比过程模型族，研究金融市场的特性和最优策略。
en_tdlr: The paper presents a unified approach to address issues in Stochastic Portfolio Theory by combining open markets and a parametric family of hybrid Jacobi processes, studying the characteristics and optimal strategies in financial markets.
